html:
Phillips After 5

Phillips after 5 is a lively mix of art and entertainment, including live music, food, and cash bar, on the first Thursday of the month. Reservations are strongly advised for this popular event.

'ARC'

“The conservative values we share with the Asian American communities are deeply important to the growth of the Republican Party.

'Marvelous Matters: Morning Tea Time' at Lady Camellia

Lady Camellia Pastry and Tea Room and Marvelously Well-Mannered have joined together to offer a “Marvelous Manners: Morning Tea Time” for children ages 6-11.

Rose Park Renovations Set to Begin in Summer

By George AltshulerCurrent Correspondent

District recreation officials plan to break ground in July on renovations to Georgetown’s Rose Park.

Pizza, Peroni & Cannoli at the Pizza Festival from Naples to Georgetown

Join il Canale ristorante for The Pizza Festival on Tuesday May 27, Wednesday 28 and Thursday May 29.

'Make It Right Foundation' Gala

Saturday night was a night filled with stars… thanks to Brad Pitt and the Make It Right Foundation, which held its second gala (the first was in 2012) at the Sugar Mill in New Orleans.
Kevin Carlson on Balance

'Thrive' Book Party

Arianna Huffington has a number one New York Times bestseller with her new book Thrive. It is in many ways a very personal book and she writes that its catalyst was a fall she took brought about by exhaustion and lack of sleep.

Avenel: A Place to Call Home & Never Leave

The Avenel address of 7020 Natelli Woods Lane is a stunning Georgian Colonial home that offers more than 8,000 square feet of finished living space in the main house plus a year round live-in pool/guest house. Price: $2,975,000.

Volta Park Cocktails & Silent Auction June 6th

This year's annual Volta Park fundraiser is a cocktail party on June 6th at 7:00 pm at the Georgetown Visitation School located at 35th and Volta. It is going to be a great event with food and drinks provided by 1789 Restaurant.

WFP Ranks #1 at Gathering of Eagles Headlined by George W. Bush

The 2014 REAL Trends 500, an annual research report ranking the performance of residential real estate firms in the United States, has recognized Washington Fine Properties (WFP) as a leader among firms for 2013.

Ann Hand Moves to Georgetown

After almost 15 years based at her MacArthur Boulevard location, Ann Hand has announced that she will be relocating her American themed jewelry brand to Georgetown in June.

A Summer Camp for Italian-Minded Kids

With the school year winding down, families are search for summer activities that are fun and enriching. One of the newest and most interesting offerings for the youngest DC residents this summer is the Giro Girotondo Summer Camp.

Edith Kuhnle Paintings at Addison/Ripley Fine Art

Addison/Ripley Fine Art is holding an opening reception for Edith Kuhnle: Transpositions Thursday, May 15th starting at 5:30 pm. The show runs through July 12, 2014

CAG Concerts in the Park: Keepin' it Green May 18th

Shake out your blankets, prepare your picnics and dig out your unwanted files and papers! What's up? The Citizen's Association of Georgetown's Concerts in the Parks -- Keepin' it Green!

Peebles Corporation to Build Mixed Use Luxury DC Hotel

Peebles Corporation and Walker Group have been selected to redevelop the land parcel located at the intersection of 5th Street and I Street NW in Ward 6.

By Katie PearceCurrent Staff Writer

Take Part!

“I am blown out tired,” said Meghan McCain, referring to the days leading up to the launch of her new show “TakePart Live” premiering on May 12th,10 PM ET/9PM CT on PIVOT TV.

Arturo Sandoval Live at Blues Alley

A protege of the legendary jazz master Dizzy Gillespie, Latin jazz legend Arturo Sandoval will be performing live at Blues Alley from Friday, May 16 through Sunday May 18.

Stunning Bannockburn House With Lighted Pool

A stunning custom-built home located in the sought-after Bannockburn neighborhood of Bethesda is being listed by Jim Bell and Kira Epstein of Beasley Real Estate.

Bike to Work Day May 16th

Once again, the Georgetown Waterfront Park will be the site of one of the pit stops. Last year, the popular location drew approximately 400 riders on their way to work.

Sewage Overflow Shuts Capital Crescent Trail

By Katie PearceCurrent Staff Writer

A major sewage spill last week continues to impact the D.C. stretch of the Capital Crescent Trail, as the city works on cleanup efforts.

De Niro & De Niro

“Legendary actor Robert De Niro is here tonight, everyone,” said Joel McHale in his remarks at The White House Correspondents’ Association dinner at The Washington Hilton.

If you ever get a chance to attend a steeplechase race, the experience most likely will be memorable.

Italian Ambassador Confers High Honor on Georgetown Lawyer

One of Italy’s highest honors was bestowed on Georgetown attorney E. David Harrison by Italian Ambassador Claudio Bisogniero in ceremonies at the Italian Embassy on Monday.

Mother's Day at 1789 Restaurant

Executive Chef Anthony Lombardo at the historic 1789 Restaurant will be dishing up a Mother’s Day a la carte brunch served from 10:00 am to 2:00 pm on Sunday, May 11th.

Playbook: Hollywood Breakfast

“I have a question that I’ve never asked before and I will never ask again,” said Politico‘s Chief White House Correspondent Mike Allen on Friday, a silence falling over the crowd. “How does the White House taste?”

Georgetown Farmers Market Opens May 7th

The Friends of Rose Park, in cooperation with the DC Department of Parks and Recreation, is sponsoring the Georgetown Farmers Market in Rose Park for its 12th season. The opening day of the Georgetown Farmers Market is Wednesday, May 7th.

Pinstripes Mother's Day Brunch

Celebrate Mother's Day with Pinstripes on Sunday, May 11. From 9:30 am.

DC Circulator Pop-Up Meeting in Georgetown May 3rd

The District Department of Transportation (DDOT) is holding a Pop-Up Meeting to solicit feedback from current and future riders on the DC Circulator bus system on Saturday, May 3 from 12 to 3 p.m. at M Street and Wisconsin Avenue NW.

Lemon Trees and Limoncello at Tudor Place May 8th

On Thursday, May 8 from 6:00 to 8:00 pm., enjoy spring weather in the historic garden amid the fragrance of blooming fruit trees long cultivated on the Tudor Place estate.

City to Collect Unwanted Cans Soon

By Graham VyseCurrent Staff Writer

Unwanted trash and recycling cans sitting on properties across Georgetown and Burleith will be collected soon — no later than a month from now and likely within a week.

Best Brunch in America: Georgetown Restaurant Makes the List

OpenTable (OPEN) has named the 2014 Diners' Choice Awards winners for the Top 100 Best Restaurants for Brunch in America.

Alice + Olivia Coming to Georgetown

EastBanc, Inc. announced Monday that Alice + Olivia, the high-style women’s clothing boutique, has signed a ten-year lease at 3303 M Street, formerly occupied by Qdoba Mexican Grill.

Georgetown Art Walk on Book Hill May 2nd

The Georgetown Galleries on Book Hill is holding their Spring Season Art Walk on Friday, May 2, from 6:00 to 8:00 pm.

Georgetown University Energy Prize of $5 Million Will Reward Community Sustainability

Tuesday, Georgetown University announced that "one lucky community with a population between 5,000 and 250,000 will receive $5 million in 2017 to support sustainable energy-saving innovations, thanks to the creation of the Georgetown University Energy Prize (GUEP)."

The Phillips Collection Showcases American Masters

The Phillips Collection has celebrated American art and artists since it opened to the public in 1921 as America’s first museum dedicated to modern art.

Designer Digs Headline 83rd House Tour

By Kat LuceroCurrent Staff Writer

Georgetown is widely famous for preserving its 18th- and 19th-century dwellings. While many share the same architectural ilk — Colonial, Federal, Victorian — their stylish interiors reflect residents’ varied tastes and lifestyles.
